FuncDef:
The radius-server packet send max-length enhance command configures the device to send RADIUS packets with a maximum length of 4096 bytes.
The undo radius-server packet send max-length enhance command restores the default configuration.
By default, the device can send RADIUS packets with a maximum length of 2048 bytes.
CLIs: undo radius-server packet send max-length enhance
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To change the default maximum length of RADIUS packets that can be sent by the device so that the device can communicate with devices of other vendors, run the radius-server packet send max-length enhance command.
Configuration Impact
The maximum length of RADIUS packets that can be sent by the device is changed to 4096 bytes.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
